nodes.bodyText: The purpose of separating this step in Travis is such that the first stage can be cached. Without that, there is no reason to explicitly call this because Gradle includes downloading dependencies within its build step.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,141 @@
+name: Continous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters

nodes.bodyText: Gotcha, will remove

+name: Continous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install FrontEnd Dependancies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:

+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+      - name: Check Backend Coverage 
+        run: ./gradlew jacocoReport

nodes.bodyText: It is overkill to use this method if just waiting for one specific item to load
Yes, will look into a better way to wait for the text to be loaded
Any reason why the component tests and lint check are run on both ubuntu and windows while e2e is only on ubuntu? I thought it should be the other way around
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+name: Continuous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: |
+          ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+          ./gradlew jacocoReport
+      - name: Generate Types 
+        run: ./gradlew generateTypes
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies 
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Frontend Tests 
+        run: npm run coverage 
+      - name: Upload to Codecov 
+        if: matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' #only upload to codecov on ubuntu VM 
+        run: bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
+  E2E-testing:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

nodes.bodyText: That is a good question - I followed our current configuration for this. We only run E2E tests on ubuntu at the moment.

nodes.bodyText:
The reason could be that E2E tests are expensive. We don't want to waste build minutes even if they are free. I think Linux minutes are cheaper than Windows and Mac minutes.
If possible to configure as such, perhaps we can run E2E on multiple platforms only when a branch is merged to master and test only on one platform for PR branches.

nodes.bodyText: For PRs, we shouldn't do more than necessary because each run adds up to developer waiting time. In fact, all the things done on windows platform should not be a hard necessity for PRs. Running on more than one browser for PRs do not actually value-add much either, especially given that E2E tests are not expected to run often these days.

+        run: bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
+  E2E-testing:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

nodes.bodyText: Use uiRetryManager instead of hard-coded wait?
Similarly here
Let's exclude chrome for the time being
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+name: Continuous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: |
+          ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+          ./gradlew jacocoReport
+      - name: Generate Types 
+        run: ./gradlew generateTypes
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies 
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Frontend Tests 
+        run: npm run coverage 
+      - name: Upload to Codecov 
+        if: matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' #only upload to codecov on ubuntu VM 
+        run: bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
+  E2E-testing:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        browser: [chrome, firefox]

nodes.bodyText: Any reason for this?

nodes.bodyText:
What I mentioned in the other thread:

Running on more than one browser for PRs do not actually value-add much either, especially given that E2E tests are not expected to run often these days.
nodes.diffHunk:
